notes: Requires warm soil (above 15Â°C). Companion basil improves health and flavor.
Sensitive to boron deficiency (heart rot). Thrives in cool weather.
Perennial herb. Divide every few years. Edible purple flowers.
Bolts in heat; prefers cool soil.
Wear gloves when harvesting. Heat-loving perennial in tropics. Pinch early flowers to encourage plant development.
Subtropical fruit tree. Hand-pollination is usually necessary (protogynous flowers). Protect from frost and strong winds.
Early bloomer. Requires winter chill hours (300-900) for fruit set.
Hill soil around stems to increase yield.
Sensitive to soil compaction. Do not transplant. Harvesting at different sizes is possible.
Plant in fall for summer harvest.
Cool season crop; bolts in heat.
Perennial; requires 2-3 years to establish. Companion tomatoes repel asparagus beetles.
Mulch with straw to keep fruit off ground.
Pinch off flowers to prolong leaf production. Companion tomatoes love basil.
Wind pollinated; plant in blocks for better pollination.
Requires soil pH 4.5-5.5. Mulch with pine needles or bark. Cross-pollination increases yield.
Heavy feeder. Trench varieties require blanching. Do not allow soil to dry out.
Extremely hot. Heat loving tropical perennial; requires protection from cold.
Biennial canes (primocane/floricane cycle). Prune floricanes after second year fruiting.
Sensitive to heat; bolts quickly. Harvest early for baby greens.
Attracts pollinators. Deep taproot; improves soil quality.
Long growing season. Frost improves flavor. Top the plant to encourage uniform sprout growth.
Heavy feeder. Surface roots; mulch to protect. Harvest when head is firm and dense.
Requires high heat and consistent water. Watch for full slip at harvest time.
Keep soil moist to prevent bolting. Attracts beneficial insects like ladybugs and hoverflies.
Deadhead spent flowers to keep them blooming. Pinch young plants for bushier growth. Drought tolerant.
Pollination (bees) is essential. Harvest regularly to encourage production. Keep soil consistently moist.
Sensitive to cold; move indoors below 10°C. Do not overwater. Remove berries to prioritize leaf growth.
Host plant for Black Swallowtail butterflies. Does not transplant well; direct sow. Stake taller varieties in windy areas.
Optimal temps 22-30°C day, 18-24°C night. Avoid over-fertilizing with nitrogen. Harvest when skin is smooth and firm.
Requires 10 weeks below 8°C for vernalization. Plant cloves 4-6 inches apart. Mulch heavily. Remove scapes on hardneck varieties.
Takes 8-10 months to mature. Cannot tolerate waterlogging. Mulch heavily. Harvest when stems yellow and die back.
Germination 7-21 days at 24-29°C. Space 18-24 inches apart. Pinch growing tips for bushier growth. Harvest when peppers reach final color.
Optimal temps 16-21°C. Can survive to -15°C. Harvest outer leaves when palm-sized. Needs 1-1.5 inches water weekly.
Germination 14-30 days. Reaches maturity in 3-5 years. Harvest when 25-30% of buds open. Prune after flowering; avoid old wood.
Optimal germination 15-20°C. Bolts above 25°C. Needs 25-30mm water weekly. Harvest 50-80 days from seed. Succession plant every 2 weeks.
